intro: Limnanthemum parnassiifolium, commonly known as the Parnassian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves that are arranged alternately along its stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
